Change-Id: Iac703d2a9b7b240a47477be8a64c7c33e28f692f
"}, {'created': '2021-06-01 22:05:55.000000000', 'message': "Only return the requested fields

A major issue with sqlalchemy is the fact that whenever a model
is interacted with, all fields are returned by the SQL database.
All fields are then converted to objects. Rinse/repeat, but on a
table such as the nodes table with a large number of fields, this
creates an exceptional amount of un-necessary work.

To lay this out:
1) SQL call completes, cursor is returned server side relatively
   quickly.
2) SQLAlchemy uses the server side cursor and functionally
   downloads the entire table. If specific columns are requested,
   but the table level model is referenced, SQLAlchemy will
   actually do even more work in order to return complete objects.
3) SQLAlchemy generates and populates the objects for each field on
   the object model, which is then passed to Ironic's code.

Prior to this change, ironic's code, for any list of all nodes,
including when only a handfull of columns were requested or needed,
all nodes would be downloaded, transformed as above, then take the
entire object and pass it up through all the layers.

In this case, if a specific list of fields is selected, the code
will take a different path. The entire objects will not be populated
but the minimum necessary columns.

Story: 2008885
Task: 42434
Change-Id: Iac703d2a9b7b240a47477be8a64c7c33e28f692f

'}, {'created': '2021-06-21 18:23:44.000000000', 'message': "Only return the requested fields from the DB

A node object has many fields, and a huge opportunity
for performance improvement is to reduce the amount of work
performed at the lower layers when it is not necessary.
In particular, the easiest case to identify and handle is
when a list of fields to be fulfilled is explicitly supplied.

This is particularlly noteworthy when we collecting a list of
nodes for synconization with Nova, where only 9 columns are
really needed to supply Nova with the information required,
and thus numerous fields are discarded.

This is all particularlly compounded when traits are used,
which presently uses a joined load pattern from SQL.

With this patch, we explicitly load and convert only the fields
requested at the lowest level, and then perform a different style
of loading node traits which requires less overhead by SQLAlchemy
to de-duplicate the returned result set to the application.

This turns out to be far more efficent as we're reducing the amount
of data/object conversion work by 360%, even before we consider
populating traits, which is performed as a separate query when
traits are requested.

Story: 2008885
Task: 42434
Change-Id: Iac703d2a9b7b240a47477be8a64c7c33e28f692f

commit_message:
Only return the requested fields from the DB

A node object has many fields, and a huge opportunity
for performance improvement is to reduce the amount of work
performed at the lower layers when it is not necessary.
In particular, the easiest case to identify and handle is
when a list of fields to be fulfilled is explicitly supplied.

This is particularlly noteworthy when we collecting a list of
nodes for synconization with Nova, where only 9 columns are
really needed to supply Nova with the information required,
and thus numerous fields are discarded.

This is all particularlly compounded when traits are used,
which presently uses a joined load pattern from SQL.

With this patch, we explicitly load and convert only the fields
requested at the lowest level, and then perform a different style
of loading node traits which requires less overhead by SQLAlchemy
to de-duplicate the returned result set to the application.

This turns out to be far more efficent as we're reducing the amount
of data/object conversion work by 360%, even before we consider
populating traits, which is performed as a separate query when
traits are requested.

Story: 2008885
Task: 42434
Change-Id: Iac703d2a9b7b240a47477be8a64c7c33e28f692f

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I461055896f9e021a80bc713ebb6c653ae4fd1fc4

commit_message:
Include status code when we fail to parse an SLO-delete response

We've occasionally seen errors here where the body is empty. Hopefully
knowing more about the response will shed some light on what happened.

Change-Id: I69c748ebf721579a5fae85333ce3d4e999b9eb2a

commit_message:
Workaround linting issue

ansible-lint<5.0.0 will try to install latest ansible as it's part of the
requirements. This brings in an issue, where lint will be broken
because of too modern ansible. We workaround this by specifying version
that won't install ansible-core and thus break linting

Change-Id: Id363f252750114413f4d8785590c962c65a05564

commit_message:
Ramdisk: do not require image_source

Because of the way validation works, the ramdisk deploy interface
currently requires an image_source in addition to kernel/ramdisk.
After 1d6441cc347cfe984721f34ebb0cd64fd9e4d876 it is no longer
necessary, and this change removes this requirement.

Change-Id: I59996fac059dade0ef186598be1e8971e073eb04

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 05:38:03.000000000', 'message': "Remove epel-release using yum/dnf

With [1] epel-next-release added as weak dep
to epel-release, so now epel-release cannot
be removed alone due to below error, so let's
used dnf/yum for removal as that will clean
the deps too.

epel-release = 8-11.el8 is needed by (installed)
epel-next-release-8-11.el8.noarch

[1] https://koji.mbox.centos.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=18210

Change-Id: I893d63bf9ffa4b960ab76a54d76af5c58ef428a7
(cherry picked from commit ea8824c436832ee16f5c84a712af89e79d92e3a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove epel-release using yum/dnf

With [1] epel-next-release added as weak dep
to epel-release, so now epel-release cannot
be removed alone due to below error, so let's
used dnf/yum for removal as that will clean
the deps too.

epel-release = 8-11.el8 is needed by (installed)
epel-next-release-8-11.el8.noarch

[1] https://koji.mbox.centos.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=18210

Change-Id: I893d63bf9ffa4b960ab76a54d76af5c58ef428a7
(cherry picked from commit ea8824c436832ee16f5c84a712af89e79d92e3a1)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8e56988043e01b1dc297c14436905462e158a889

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I68f4532963f06362fbd84f18811adfaea3c7315e

messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-09 18:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-22 12:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello keyston team,

Please can you validate this patch?'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2021-06-29 18:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-07-02 14:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-02 14:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Waiting for the +W until zuul restarts'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-02 15:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 18:54:13.000000000', 'message': "[keystone] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I91b146fafd3f15490e2295aa6765263af0365bf1
"}]
commit_message:
[keystone] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I91b146fafd3f15490e2295aa6765263af0365bf1

Add local ganesha.conf for specific configuration

In addition to providing the Ganesha recommended Ceph
FSAL configuration, this change includes a Manila driver
requirement of including the Ganesha export path

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/567

Closes-Bug: #1889287

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 19:23:39.000000000', 'message': "[senlin] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I53e011f2656483cfec8194929486d4ec1ebe6230
"}]
commit_message:
[senlin] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I53e011f2656483cfec8194929486d4ec1ebe6230

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5c234d5630507f7d89c3ba089e12e3a2e7121758

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 03:29:39.000000000', 'message': 'Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() when ovs restarts

When ovs restarts and needs to regenerate flows, some flows will be
missing in br-int, as follows:
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="int-br-floating" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="patch-tun" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=61,priority=0 actions=resubmit(,62)
Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() again in the
_handle_ovs_restart() to ensure generate these flows.

Change-Id: I240a78879db757592df138a53b2c22d7f5a9ae13
Closes-Bug: #1920700
(cherry picked from commit 2bb52d49bec299f070a513fee6f9f7ae5d53118b)

 * table=61,priority=0 actions=resubmit(,62)

_handle_ovs_restart() to ensure generate these flows.

commit_message:
Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() when ovs restarts

When ovs restarts and needs to regenerate flows, some flows will be
missing in br-int, as follows:
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="int-br-floating" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="patch-tun" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=61,priority=0 actions=resubmit(,62)
Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() again in the
_handle_ovs_restart() to ensure generate these flows.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I240a78879db757592df138a53b2c22d7f5a9ae13
Closes-Bug: #1920700
(cherry picked from commit 2bb52d49bec299f070a513fee6f9f7ae5d53118b)
(cherry picked from commit 27ade26b64446554135e5d6f04c0927de314377a)

commit_message:
Handle service client authorization errors

Authorization errors when connecting
to nova/glance/neutron/cinder can be raised as
BadConfigurationExceptions in the logs. We shouldn't
be raising exceptions derived from the service client
libraries.

Change-Id: I2d47dbb1251dfa8d529f813724fb7fd97d7d3a0b
Closes-Bug: #1921927
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-04 08:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-05 02:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-06-07 09:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-11 07:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-06-14 09:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-16 14:02:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I see that though these deliverables are cycle-with-intermediary they were mostly doing major version bump between releases. And this patch follows the same rule. However, cycle-with-intermediary requires only to bump minor version. And 'reno semver' suggests the same, so only minor version bumps instead of major version bump in some cases here.

I guess that is possible to bump major versions despite that the model is cycle-with-intermediary... Anyway, I'm giving only +1 now and let you respond, as I'm not 100% sure..."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-21 01:34:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
> 
> I see that though these deliverables are cycle-with-intermediary they were mostly doing major version bump between releases. And this patch follows the same rule. However, cycle-with-intermediary requires only to bump minor version. And 'reno semver' suggests the same, so only minor version bumps instead of major version bump in some cases here.
> 
> I guess that is possible to bump major versions despite that the model is cycle-with-intermediary... Anyway, I'm giving only +1 now and let you respond, as I'm not 100% sure...

The puppet openstack project has always been upgraded like this before"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-21 11:46:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
> 
> I see that though these deliverables are cycle-with-intermediary they were mostly doing major version bump between releases. And this patch follows the same rule. However, cycle-with-intermediary requires only to bump minor version. And 'reno semver' suggests the same, so only minor version bumps instead of major version bump in some cases here.
> 
> I guess that is possible to bump major versions despite that the model is cycle-with-intermediary... Anyway, I'm giving only +1 now and let you respond, as I'm not 100% sure...

Usually they start new cycles with a major bump, examples:

- https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/train/puppet-aodh.yaml#L12
- https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/ussuri/puppet-aodh.yaml#L12
- https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/deliverables/wallaby/puppet-aodh.yaml#L12"}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2021-06-21 11:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-21 12:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-22 12:32:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 -Workflow

Your metadata don't match the given versions.

Example with puppet-barbican:

https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican/commit/0d364bc202cc1ff69522a32efd47681b66c0aa1b

Here you ask for a major version (19.0.0) but your metadata request a minor version (19.1.0).

They should be aligned to allow us to continue.
Either:
1) you downgrade them on the project side (puppet-*) and you keep the version as they are
2) you update the versions here to match your metadata

However the second option will skip the major version and you'll move from 18.4.0 to 19.1.0 (e.g  puppet-barbican will skip 19.0.0). I really prefer the first option.

I -1'd to highlight the need of changes.

I think that we didn't see early this validation issue due to a bug that have been fixed few days ago [1] in our validation module. We apologies for the side effects. 

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/9504e96b5df4bd26d87c36681fecca5b27872a9d"}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-28 08:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-07-02 13:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

hashes are corrected and validators passing. adding back +W.'}]

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ie754caa8fa73b6204c66d19f2edfc251c27905db
"}]
commit_message:
[swift] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ie754caa8fa73b6204c66d19f2edfc251c27905db

commit_message:
[barbican] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ifeeb54d80f887400d4dde2f17d9b73289d524baa

commit_message:
Make it possible to override automatic fluentd version detection

One use case for this is so that you can generate config in a CI job
without access to the container repository. It also removes the
dependency of having docker configured for config generation.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0d388851c8b953af0494e44ae569e7eb9e15c326
(cherry picked from commit 25c33f9c9477c3a7b5f48a50157b16b1b7c595b1)

Remove outdated upgrade step

Migrating to Ironic hardware types was required in Rocky. This can now
be removed from upgrading instructions.

Change-Id: I0510db9fd1b8dd72540c83173267491b32728330
(cherry picked from commit bca23698947aeccc2e2ed300eeb6487a0711873f)

commit_message:
Update description of the templates option

The templates option should point to a directory instead of a file, but
its current description doesn't clearly explain that.
This change updates its description so that it is clearly explained
that the value should be a directory path and regarded as a home
directory of template files.

The existing descriptions with 't-h-t' are also updated because
the word might be unclear for users.

Change-Id: Ib1857c259108a0a13909ca53e54105f1f6bda710

Change-Id: Idd905e32dc70728abdb4cea1a14f43c7f11ff311

commit_message:
Add --db-only option in undercloud_backup.

This patch adds a new option --db-only which will perform a DB backup
of the Undercloud node. This option will have precedence to --init, --setup-nfs
or --setup-rear, but it won't complain. If the --db-only option is being
passed then only the play in charge of performing the Undercloud's DB backup
will be triggered.

Change-Id: Idd905e32dc70728abdb4cea1a14f43c7f11ff311
Resolves: rhbz#1977392
Depends-On: I62cadfd95c514edf0b982fa652a53feadb24f2b7
(cherry picked from commit a792bbd8747455f468ef94d5162847c17d243735)

Adds ``NeutronAuthStrategy`` and ``IronicAuthStrategy``
parameters and makes the necessary changes in the services
to deploy using them.

commit_message:
Trigger Validation on standalone job with tripleo CLI command

In order to test the TripleO CLI for Validations and the whole chain to avoid
blocker and regression, this patch enable Validation at the end of the Standalone job.

The cost of it, is arround 3 or 4 minutes max.

Change-Id: Ide76602bc4ccf217af00678485d8ea5c5f462bfe

but by nova templates.

exist some leftovers. This change removes all of the remaining usage.

subject: Bump py36 to py38 in tox.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12369, 'name': 'Pure Storage CI', 'username': 'purestorage-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 30092, 'date': '2020-10-12 00:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2020-10-22 16:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

3.6 is still a runtime for Wallaby:
    https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html

so why do this?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-12-07 14:46:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Given that 3.6 and 3.8 are both valid runtimes for Wallaby, and given that these tests run quickly, I don't see a problem with leaving both of them for the default tox run.

I know that Sean is of the opinion that instead of either py36 or py38, we should just specify py3 so that the default tox runs against the default python 3 on the developer's system, and then we can count on the gate running the py3.6 and py3.8 unit tests.  I don't know how I feel about that, but if you want to revise this patch to promote discussion, I'd be OK with that.  Otherwise, please abandon the patch.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-02 12:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-brick/+/798956'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 00:39:02.000000000', 'message': 'Bump py36 to py38 in tox.ini

Change-Id: I73a468d6d942a71a534e3bbe7c52eb5c48998e14
'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-23 15:34:30.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Clean up ipxe support

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this and also change the default
ipxe binary for EFI from ipxe.efi which is intended to contain
firmware, and snponly.efi which only has the EFI networking stack.
In the vast majority of cases, short of very broken EFI firmware,
operators need snponly.efi.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b

commit_message:
Clean up ipxe support

The puppet-ironic module's ipxe support does not align with current
versions of ironic which delineated ipxe and pxe support quite some
time ago.

This is an attempt to reconcile this and also change the default
ipxe binary for EFI from ipxe.efi which is intended to contain
firmware, and snponly.efi which only has the EFI networking stack.
In the vast majority of cases, short of very broken EFI firmware,
operators need snponly.efi.

Change-Id: Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b

commit_message:
Remove epel-release using yum/dnf

With [1] epel-next-release added as weak dep
to epel-release, so now epel-release cannot
be removed alone due to below error, so let's
used dnf/yum for removal as that will clean
the deps too.

epel-release = 8-11.el8 is needed by (installed)
epel-next-release-8-11.el8.noarch

[1] https://koji.mbox.centos.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=18210

Change-Id: I893d63bf9ffa4b960ab76a54d76af5c58ef428a7
(cherry picked from commit ea8824c436832ee16f5c84a712af89e79d92e3a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-01 12:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Honor role and networks file constants

Prior to change Ic9db8d852fbfa50f4ac574ebe524c1fb1d85c588
the tripleoclient constants OVERCLOUD_ROLES_FILE and
OVERCLOUD_NETWORKS_FILE was used as the defaults.

This was changed to use the defaults in process-templates.py

This restores the previous behaviour, honoring the tripleoclient
constants.

Closes-Bug: #1934010
Change-Id: Ie133a6718ca50f30fee7a48fc83ff0e89d84d2dc
(cherry picked from commit a586cb7795cf301c968fafa2e6fd9e5201220977)
'}]
commit_message:
Honor role and networks file constants

Prior to change Ic9db8d852fbfa50f4ac574ebe524c1fb1d85c588
the tripleoclient constants OVERCLOUD_ROLES_FILE and
OVERCLOUD_NETWORKS_FILE was used as the defaults.

This was changed to use the defaults in process-templates.py

This restores the previous behaviour, honoring the tripleoclient
constants.

Closes-Bug: #1934010
Change-Id: Ie133a6718ca50f30fee7a48fc83ff0e89d84d2dc
(cherry picked from commit a586cb7795cf301c968fafa2e6fd9e5201220977)

In python3.8.11 and python3.9.6, the behavior of the
ipaddress.ip_network.hosts() method changed. Now /32
addresses are returned by that method as a single
element list. This was apparently done as a bugfix [1]

Change-Id: Iab6d96351fa21131d834ccf07ffddd70555f25a7
Closes-Bug: #1934345
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix ipaddress issues in the infinidat driver

In python3.8.11 and python3.9.6, the behavior of the
ipaddress.ip_network.hosts() method changed. Now /32
addresses are returned by that method as a single
element list. This was apparently done as a bugfix [1]

Change-Id: Iab6d96351fa21131d834ccf07ffddd70555f25a7
Closes-Bug: #1934345
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue27683
(cherry picked from commit 1161a56a74b0fd926c20a63242af9dc852f56401)

commit_message:
Add Ceph Dashboard and the monitoring stack to the cephadm doc

The new cephadm doc should include how the monitoring stack
components can be added to the overcloud deployment command.
This change represents a rework of [1] and adapts the existing
content to the new deployment tool.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/ceph_config.html

Change-Id: Ie06559745893df30853b4eb724dc75e7bc5daf15

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 06:55:20.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic8793866bfde33c7ad634a76d263aa71fa4d42c6
"}, {'created': '2021-06-30 17:10:08.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic8793866bfde33c7ad634a76d263aa71fa4d42c6

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this version isn't longer officially supported.

Change-Id: Ia5ab41670c8f341126a730af54f7ece9b6b79f73

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-01 16:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-02 08:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-01 11:35:20.000000000', 'message': 'magnum: Add CA certificate configuration for internal TLS

Magnum has various sections in its configuration file for OpenStack
clients. When internal TLS is enabled, these may need a CA certificate
to be specified.

This change adds a CA certificate configuration, based on
openstack_cacert, for all clients using internal endpoints.

Note: we are explicitly not adding the configuration for the
[magnum_client] ca_file and [drivers] openstack_ca_file options, since
these use the public endpoint by default. These options may be
provided via custom configuration if necessary.

Change-Id: Ie59b3777c0a2c142b580addd67e279bc4b2f2c90
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Dean
Closes-Bug: #1919389
(cherry picked from commit 48f0957a1c9c3ef0cac77642f058fa9cb47fbbc8)
'}]
commit_message:
magnum: Add CA certificate configuration for internal TLS

Magnum has various sections in its configuration file for OpenStack
clients. When internal TLS is enabled, these may need a CA certificate
to be specified.

This change adds a CA certificate configuration, based on
openstack_cacert, for all clients using internal endpoints.

Note: we are explicitly not adding the configuration for the
[magnum_client] ca_file and [drivers] openstack_ca_file options, since
these use the public endpoint by default. These options may be
provided via custom configuration if necessary.

Change-Id: Ie59b3777c0a2c142b580addd67e279bc4b2f2c90
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Dean
Closes-Bug: #1919389
(cherry picked from commit 48f0957a1c9c3ef0cac77642f058fa9cb47fbbc8)

commit_message:
magnum: Add CA certificate configuration for internal TLS

Magnum has various sections in its configuration file for OpenStack
clients. When internal TLS is enabled, these may need a CA certificate
to be specified.

This change adds a CA certificate configuration, based on
openstack_cacert, for all clients using internal endpoints.

Note: we are explicitly not adding the configuration for the
[magnum_client] ca_file and [drivers] openstack_ca_file options, since
these use the public endpoint by default. These options may be
provided via custom configuration if necessary.

Change-Id: Ie59b3777c0a2c142b580addd67e279bc4b2f2c90
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Dean
Closes-Bug: #1919389
(cherry picked from commit 48f0957a1c9c3ef0cac77642f058fa9cb47fbbc8)

commit_message:
CI: Avoid generating a nova key in ceph-ansible scenario

We use the cinder key for Nova by default, so a separate nova key is no
longer used.

Change-Id: I49ce6d36747e6c7d3a389d0afd2d034e8afdf8ed
(cherry picked from commit 6e18495892a9fbe0431764cbd18f7a2e902d8746)

commit_message:
Fix zuul builds with dependencies and pep8 rules

This updates hacking to 3.2 thereby removing the pyflakes
dependency. In addition pep8 rules W503 is disabled in
favor of the more recent W504.

Co-authored-by: limin.lc <limin.lc@inspur.com>

commit_message:
Move charm-cinder-backup-swift-proxy to new hacking 4.0.0

This patch changes old assert checks to new optimal assert
checks provided by hacking plugin in release 4.0.0.
Please refer [1] for optimal assert checks details.

The patch modifies following,
 * Changes assertTrue/False(A in/not in B, message) to assertIn/NotIn(A, B, message).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/hacking/unreleased.html#relnotes-4-0-0

Change-Id: Ie95e429ac63ecbc61a728f52c32171ba3133414c

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt and use fedora 29 image

This is a combination of 2 commits, that are required to pass the gate:

1. Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

In test jobs the script tools/test-setup.sh is called which requires
mysql and postgres servers and clients to be installed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

(cherry picked from commit d116b216965bbfc80840f5bfc994b731e2d29d81)

Note(elod.illes): patch is modified, as bandit is not in blacklist.txt
at stable/ocata, but it is upper-constrained (upper-constraint.txt) so
the limiting of it is not needed here.

Conflicts:
      tox.ini

2. Use fedora 29 image from nodepool mirror

It seems fedora 27 cloud images are not available.

Conflicts:
    heat_integrationtests/prepare_test_env.sh

Change-Id: I199afcbaa5050226a333779ac22aea3451f94b04
(cherry picked from commit b5333aea94237fe8388ef5bdf2f758d5fedfc887)

Note(elod.illes): Patch 2. is cherry-picked from Queens as Pike version
contains extra patch that is not necessary in Ocata to make the gate
pass.

Change-Id: If9befe4115c64c2fda52321002ba5fe1124eaf7c
(cherry picked from commit 916fd05627dddce33a577038f983e17295cc44e8)
(cherry picked from commit ec50bb8fa46f909d642f1f3af4f3c3d558d11de8)
(cherry picked from commit 478f752ee4a01bc9f03d99af7e15980b9e45c2db)
(cherry picked from commit 2959e525e74ea36b42ae472f52b0fa4a3a1bdc7e)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I55be460e649d40b1cb4790b6aafffd468eb99558

[{'created': '2021-01-24 11:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate all quota parameters to [quotas] section.

Currently we register all parameters about the quota feature to
[DEFAULT] section. However it is difficult for operators to identity
that some of these parameters like reservation_expire are used in the
quota feature, based of names and descriptions of the parameters.

This change migrates all quota options to the new [quotas] section,
so that operators can easily understand which parameters are used
in the quota feature.

Change-Id: I9ebf6d66a59eec6c5564aaa1e234c79c2a8de27c
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate all quota parameters to [quotas] section.

Currently we register all parameters about the quota feature to
[DEFAULT] section. However it is difficult for operators to identity
that some of these parameters like reservation_expire are used in the
quota feature, based of names and descriptions of the parameters.

This change migrates all quota options to the new [quotas] section,
so that operators can easily understand which parameters are used
in the quota feature.

Change-Id: I9ebf6d66a59eec6c5564aaa1e234c79c2a8de27c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 08:35:54.000000000', 'message': 'Backup&Restore Snapshots RFE

The backup&restore process on the controller needs to be done with
the controller stopped. If that condition is not met, we risk
introducing race conditions that could create unrestorable
non-consistent backups. Currently, the B&R process stops the three
controllers to perform a backup, leaving the cloud unmanageable
during the duration of the backup, which can take several minutes.

This change introduces the capability of doing "serial" backups.
Managing Pacemaker lets us take a node out of the controller
Pacemaker cluster, take a backup from it and introduce it again
on the cluster. While that backup is being done, the other two
nodes of the controller cluster continue to be available to
manage the cloud.

Bugzilla: #1877798
Change-Id: I77c4e6accc205cbc962c663babe1018b51d8d266
(cherry picked from commit ebcfee5f20974a16d1c58570953b855d90f9eef2)
'}]
commit_message:
Backup&Restore Snapshots RFE

The backup&restore process on the controller needs to be done with
the controller stopped. If that condition is not met, we risk
introducing race conditions that could create unrestorable
non-consistent backups. Currently, the B&R process stops the three
controllers to perform a backup, leaving the cloud unmanageable
during the duration of the backup, which can take several minutes.

This change introduces the capability of doing "serial" backups.
Managing Pacemaker lets us take a node out of the controller
Pacemaker cluster, take a backup from it and introduce it again
on the cluster. While that backup is being done, the other two
nodes of the controller cluster continue to be available to
manage the cloud.

Bugzilla: #1877798
Change-Id: I77c4e6accc205cbc962c663babe1018b51d8d266
(cherry picked from commit ebcfee5f20974a16d1c58570953b855d90f9eef2)

commit_message:
Preface tasks path with {{playbook_dir}}

When checking for the existence of task files at a given path, the path
should be prefaced with {{playbook_dir}} so that the correct absolute
path is checked. Otherwise, the path is relative to the working
directory which does not have to be the same as playbook_dir.

Change-Id: Ia16f249b240c06128374551f6110419f9c1923c9
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

commit_message:
CI: Avoid generating a nova key in ceph-ansible scenario

We use the cinder key for Nova by default, so a separate nova key is no
longer used.

Change-Id: I49ce6d36747e6c7d3a389d0afd2d034e8afdf8ed
(cherry picked from commit 6e18495892a9fbe0431764cbd18f7a2e902d8746)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-29 21:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'tuned: install all profiles by default

Tuned profiles were not installed before, and it was up to the operator
to do it, based on which profile they use. This can be problematic and
error-prone, so this patch installs all the profiles by default.

Closes-Bug: #1934017
Change-Id: I6f7f54b469b8fe36f338fbb3f18e032baf5ecc84
'}, {'created': '2021-06-29 21:39:10.000000000', 'message': "tuned: install cpu-partitioning profile by default

To match with what we find in the overcloud image, let's install
tuned-profiles-cpu-partitioning so when not using the image (in
standalone, or on an undercloud or just with already deployed servers),
the rpm will be there already and the profile can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1934017
Change-Id: I6f7f54b469b8fe36f338fbb3f18e032baf5ecc84
"}]
commit_message:
tuned: install cpu-partitioning profile by default

To match with what we find in the overcloud image, let's install
tuned-profiles-cpu-partitioning so when not using the image (in
standalone, or on an undercloud or just with already deployed servers),
the rpm will be there already and the profile can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1934017
Change-Id: I6f7f54b469b8fe36f338fbb3f18e032baf5ecc84

Revert "Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable"

This reverts commit ba394096fd853d09c7e4ad162b6852b09b109532.

NOTE(elod.illes): devstack in Rocky is fixed and grenade jobs started
to pass in Stein. We can enable grenades again to restore testing as it
was before.

Change-Id: I9bf0198cef39169b54daec607067916d3c1a4269

[{'created': '2017-07-03 09:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update log translation hacking rule

Starting with the Pike series, OpenStack no longer supports log
translation.
Update hacking rule to prevent log translation in all log level instead
of only debug level.

Change-Id: I99e7b57906c93a37fd7e9bbf320f3370d01f93ef
'}]
commit_message:
Update log translation hacking rule

Starting with the Pike series, OpenStack no longer supports log
translation.
Update hacking rule to prevent log translation in all log level instead
of only debug level.

Change-Id: I99e7b57906c93a37fd7e9bbf320f3370d01f93ef

commit_message:
[CentOS-7] pin os_tempest ansible role to a known hash

Currently os_tempest ansible role is used from master in
tripleo CI job for all releases.

Recently https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/784885
got merged which Rename whitelist and blacklist in role and
following changes is introduced in tempest-26.0.0 .

For older releases running on CentOS-7 does not uses latest
version of tempest and updating to latest release requires lots
of work which is not cost effective as C7 branches are going
EOL very soon.

Pinning it a commit [1]which landed before that above commit
will use the blacklist feature and works az expected.

Note: I need to toggle the required projects for c7 and c8 as
yaml anchor does work there to update data at list level.

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/792628/1
Closes-Bug: #1933922

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifc8c26825d8e37cd97428a4eacbe8b5bb1659820

subject: Spec Lite: Policy tests refactoring
messages:
[{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-23 07:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-24 13:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Definitely agree with the goal here, just a couple nits about the wording. I think that the easiest thing to do is to do this refactoring in parallel with some of the actual policy refactor work, just so we avoid doing it twice. However, there are probably a bunch of tests that could be refactored by changing the policy.yaml to our current default and then fixing the resulting test breaks. I think this is pretty much what we (you?) did for the metadef changes recently, so there might be other low-priority areas like that which we could do in parallel to the image api policy refactorings going on right now.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-24 15:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with Dan as far as changing the wording.

Basically, relying on a policy.yaml for tests dates back to the days when we shipped a policy file with cinder that contained the defaults.  The goal of the tests was to make sure the defaults functioned the way they were supposed to.  We still want to preserve that goal, but now that the defaults are in code, that's what we should be testing.  And it will be a bonus if you can make it easy to change policy values during tests so that we can test other scenarios as well.

So +1 for the idea, not a +2 because you need to make the revisions identified by Dan."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-25 06:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying
this mistake around.

See https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-skipsdist
and https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/1388 for details.

Change-Id: Iac474f1d458c3b803eb28a33bd05002db31c4689

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-01 11:59:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use role var names from tripleo_podman

The tripleo_podman role expects these vars to be prefixed with
"tripleo_". Instead of using a different set of vars that don't use a
prefix and having to default the values everywhere, just use the roles
var names, so we can rely on the role setting the right defaults from
its defaults/main.yml[1].

Also, we can avoid having to explicitly pass in vars to later tasks
since they have already been set earlier.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_podman/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: Ia2bb68bcff61cc3a88b32e0a0d99b4a4763160ba

commit_message:
Use role var names from tripleo_podman

The tripleo_podman role expects these vars to be prefixed with
"tripleo_". Instead of using a different set of vars that don't use a
prefix and having to default the values everywhere, just use the roles
var names, so we can rely on the role setting the right defaults from
its defaults/main.yml[1].

Also, we can avoid having to explicitly pass in vars to later tasks
since they have already been set earlier.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_podman/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: Ia2bb68bcff61cc3a88b32e0a0d99b4a4763160ba
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rename hieradata_files result var

This var is used internally in tripleo-ansible tripleo_hieradata role so
the check result is overwriting the variable used to generate hiera.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1933850
Change-Id: I9b6cdad78f834c097226bd1681fa2e13791c33aa
(cherry picked from commit 2118998220805bc34e99dc5875bc6c711939fa5c)
(cherry picked from commit d6b493303955911c9aa1568e3e0dbaaff250b161)

commit_message:
directly use files instread of tcib_gather_files

convert tcib_gather_files for kolla related files to install
the openstack-tripleo-common-containers rpm and use those directly
instead of copying into the container image.

Change-Id: I7384243e9e3d804c05fdd1689b6ae3c9306bbb31
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[VxFlex OS] Fix resource name typo in template

The resource name should be CinderBackendDellEMCVxFlexOS instead of
CinderBackendVxFlexOS.

Change-Id: I2460c87eb8e7de709e88949311e2bf70c0ada2d3
Closes-Bug: #1903634

messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-07-01 12:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-07-01 14:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-01 12:10:54.000000000', 'message': "Add THT Jinja2 data sources as stack output

This simply stores the data structure in the network_data
and roles_data YAML files provided with the -n and -r
options when deploying the overcloud.

This can be generally useful for troubleshooting.

Also the 'overcloud node extract provision' command rely
on the roles data source. Storing it in the stack means
we can get to the data in case the user missplaced the
file originally used, or in the case where we want to
automate the process for all deployed stacks.

NOTE: The idea is to backport this to the release intended
as the upgrade from release, so that the follow on change
Icc6a7a438e9d0f39d003d1cf8ed84d6fb1d5485a can use it during
upgrade.

Conflicts:
  overcloud.j2.yaml

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I1efecdcd7afa6af3e6b4b26f4435198836db535f
(cherry picked from commit 0b5b914e312c25a956b412c0702064b65fafdab6)
"}]
commit_message:
Add THT Jinja2 data sources as stack output

This simply stores the data structure in the network_data
and roles_data YAML files provided with the -n and -r
options when deploying the overcloud.

This can be generally useful for troubleshooting.

Also the 'overcloud node extract provision' command rely
on the roles data source. Storing it in the stack means
we can get to the data in case the user missplaced the
file originally used, or in the case where we want to
automate the process for all deployed stacks.

NOTE: The idea is to backport this to the release intended
as the upgrade from release, so that the follow on change
Icc6a7a438e9d0f39d003d1cf8ed84d6fb1d5485a can use it during
upgrade.

Conflicts:
  overcloud.j2.yaml

Related: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: I1efecdcd7afa6af3e6b4b26f4435198836db535f
(cherry picked from commit 0b5b914e312c25a956b412c0702064b65fafdab6)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iaa1756e967109e079e23df341d032f0b3120ef6d

commit_message:
Drop noauth_policy and use the default

This drops the noauth policy file and instead uses the heat
defaults in the code. This would avoid us moving to the
new yaml based policy files.

commit_message:
Fix ordering of Swift pipeline values

The ordering of the Swift pipeline values is
important. If they are written to the config file
without the name of the app last, it causes Swift
Proxy to fail as per:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1934172

Closes-Bug: #1934172
Change-Id: Ic04aec43068a9aaf6beadc3236c679cc26db63c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 17:43:16.000000000', 'message': "db: Fold in ForeignKey constraints

Yet another thing to ease the path of the alembic migration. Once again,
there are some odd things here that require explanation. Firstly, we
need to work around the fact that some foreign keys are named when using
a MySQL or SQLite backend but not when using PostgreSQL. This is
addressed via a custom compile rule [1] that simply drops the name
argument for PostgreSQL, based on the assumption that we will not start
naming these constraints going forward (this seems sane given we've
stopped doing it for MySQL and SQLite). I had initially attempted to
solve this using dialect-specific keyword arguments, specifically, by
using the 'argument_for' function [2] to add a 'mysql_name' parameter,
but that doesn't seem to work as expected [3]. In addition to this, the
two foreign keys that were added without specific names ended up using
the sqlalchemy-migrate derived names of '%(table)s_%(firstcolumn)s_fkey'
[4] which we must replicate to prevent schema changes.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/compiler.html
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/constraints.html#sqlalchemy.schema.ColumnCollectionConstraint.argument_for
[3] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5944
[4] https://opendev.org/x/sqlalchemy-migrate/src/commit/5d1f322542cd8eb42381612765be4ed9ca8105ec/migrate/changeset/constraint.py#L126-L139

Change-Id: I794cb5ed277b33e90087221b38b287e1132b639a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-05-11 14:29:03.000000000', 'message': "db: Fold in ForeignKey constraints

commit_message:
db: Fold in ForeignKey constraints

Yet another thing to ease the path of the alembic migration. Once again,
there are some odd things here that require explanation. Firstly, we
need to work around the fact that some foreign keys are named when using
a MySQL or SQLite backend but not when using PostgreSQL. This is
addressed via a custom compile rule [1] that simply drops the name
argument for PostgreSQL, based on the assumption that we will not start
naming these constraints going forward (this seems sane given we've
stopped doing it for MySQL and SQLite). I had initially attempted to
solve this using dialect-specific keyword arguments, specifically, by
using the 'argument_for' function [2] to add a 'mysql_name' parameter,
but that doesn't seem to work as expected [3]. In addition to this, the
two foreign keys that were added without specific names ended up using
the sqlalchemy-migrate derived names of '%(table)s_%(firstcolumn)s_fkey'
[4] which we must replicate to prevent schema changes.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/compiler.html
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/constraints.html#sqlalchemy.schema.ColumnCollectionConstraint.argument_for
[3] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5944
[4] https://opendev.org/x/sqlalchemy-migrate/src/commit/5d1f322542cd8eb42381612765be4ed9ca8105ec/migrate/changeset/constraint.py#L126-L139

Change-Id: I794cb5ed277b33e90087221b38b287e1132b639a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-29 08:59:46.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I729d4c4af6a96fc12ff99465bdefd513e47e6a86

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-25 21:06:08.000000000', 'message': 'fix sr-iov support on Cavium ThunderX hosts.

This change is a partial revert of
Ibf8dca4bd57b3bddb39955b53cc03564506f5754
to reintoduce a try excpet which is required for
some non standard hardware.

On the Cavium ThunderX plathform its possible to have
Virutal function which are netdevs which are not associated
to a PF. This causes the PF name lookup to fail.
Prior to Ibf8dca4bd57b3bddb39955b53cc03564506f5754
when the lookup failed it was caught and we skipped
populating the parent PF interface name.

This change restores that behavior.
Closes-Bug: #1915255

Change-Id: Ia10ccdd9fbed3870d0592e3cbbff17f292651dd2
'}, {'created': '2021-02-25 21:25:52.000000000', 'message': 'fix sr-iov support on Cavium ThunderX hosts.

commit_message:
fix sr-iov support on Cavium ThunderX hosts.

This change is a partial revert of
Ibf8dca4bd57b3bddb39955b53cc03564506f5754
to reintoduce a try-except which is required for
some non standard hardware.

On the Cavium ThunderX platform, it's possible to have
virutal functions which are netdevs which are not associated
to a PF. This causes the PF name lookup to fail.
Prior to Ibf8dca4bd57b3bddb39955b53cc03564506f5754
when the lookup failed it was caught and we skipped
populating the parent PF interface name.

This change restores that behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1915255
Change-Id: Ia10ccdd9fbed3870d0592e3cbbff17f292651dd2

commit_message:
Move designate from experimental

A lot of work has been done on designate in the wallaby cycle and its
basic functionality deploys normally. There is an active team working on
the component and the deployment support.

Change-Id: I5cda7df93cc56dd9691a9d5857de455d0f539897
(cherry picked from commit b991086fea01ec9b98dd7b2eb947df1b8ade5d0e)

commit_message:
Support additional IP so bind and unbound can collocate

Adds support for collocating bind and unbound resolver on the same host.
Also adds handling for standalone deployments.

This is a squashed commit of the original patch plus change
Id17dec07c2aa0a3b080eb05f71c637d6a422ec41 (commit
857807247d8f1a7270fdade30f570bf2f17789ce).  Squashing was necessary
since the original change broke CI.

Depends-On: I445418bb52fa38604c797a9dc69492edb0a41a8c
Depends-On: I398d24406bafdb34dd0cf793ade8e4085d8fd1b0
Change-Id: Icdc6267b92f6272a7f296759e5ce9752dd42fab0
(cherry picked from commit 807d5a6e5b5eccce20262521c1f5d542aab0eeac)

commit_message:
Add comment for libvirt/vnc network sync

In I08fa1ee947574e6fac24885b17706a22054fcba9 we added sync of
NovaLibvirtNetwork and NovaVncProxyNetwork. This just adds a
comment for this.

commit_message:
Remove NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap

In Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2 we moved to use
NovaLibvirtNetwork as the single network to configure instance console
components.
Due to how hieradata is being rendered via tripleo-hieradata, the
removed NovaVncProxyNetwork resulted in no-vnc-proxy service to
fall back to the control plane network because NovaVncProxyNetwork
was removed.
NovaVncProxyNetwork was then reintroduced with
I595294956a4a7a0e2280c685ac1d2543edbc32f2 but as a side effect
again introduced the inconsistency on the console configuration.

This patch removes the NovaVncProxyNetwork from ServiceNetMap
but set it as part of service_net_map.j2.yaml and keep it in
sync with NovaLibvirtNetwork.

Conflicts:
    network/service_net_map.j2.yaml
    overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml

Change-Id: I08fa1ee947574e6fac24885b17706a22054fcba9
Closes-Bug: #1917719
(cherry picked from commit 9da8a405952623e42f52e13ac948da1e57cf6906)
(cherry picked from commit 2f0689d8d7e4078c4e9c025c3deb9b9e0a638d05)

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded cloud_name and auth_type used

We use stackrc which sets OS_CLOUD env variable, when running
the cli playbooks. We've been removing hardcoded cloud_names
specified in playbooks to not conflict with it.

Also, 'auth_type' would be picked from clouds.yaml and not
required to be passed an argument.

For standalone ironic using noauth, clouds.yaml would look
like below and there is no need to have any logic in the
modules.

clouds:
  undercloud:
    auth: {}
    auth_type: none
    baremetal_api_version: '1'
    baremetal_endpoint_override: https://192.168.24.2:13385

Change-Id: Iacf16819ee98ed9d41abbe0e7f6a77f36e803de2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 13:06:09.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Prevent circular inventory group when overcloud stack does not exist

If the overcloud stack does not exist but is in a list of plans and is
the first on that list it can result in the group:

overcloud:
  children:
    overcloud: {}

This patch changes the child group to the first plan that exists or
omits the overcloud group completely if no plans exist.

Requires I98dbbaaea25a0d61674e989eca8d2daf6090ebc4 which omits
non-existing stacks from the plan list.

Change-Id: I60481cf09524dcb8309ee9ff097a4c8bc5dcc12c

commit_message:
[train-only] Prevent circular inventory group when overcloud stack does not exist

If the overcloud stack does not exist but is in a list of plans and is
the first on that list it can result in the group:

overcloud:
  children:
    overcloud: {}

Requires I98dbbaaea25a0d61674e989eca8d2daf6090ebc4 which omits
non-existing stacks from the plan list.

This patch changes the child group to the first plan that exists or
omits the overcloud group completely if no plans exist.

Change-Id: I60481cf09524dcb8309ee9ff097a4c8bc5dcc12c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-14 17:43:16.000000000', 'message': "db: Synchronize function signatures

A number of the abstract APIs in 'nova.db.api' had a different function
signature to their concrete implementations in 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api'.
Correct this. Functions changed include:

- action_get_by_request_id
- create_context_manager
- instance_add_security_group
- instance_extra_update_by_uuid
- instance_get_all_by_filters
- instance_remove_security_group
- migration_get
- migration_get_by_id_and_instance
- pci_device_update
- service_get_minimum_version
- virtual_interface_delete_by_instance
- virtual_interface_get_by_instance
- virtual_interface_get_by_instance_and_network

To do this, the following script was used:

  >>> import nova.db.api as base_api
  >>> import nova.db.sqlalchemy.api as sqla_api
  >>> import collections
  >>> import inspect
  >>> for name in dir(base_api):
  ...     fn_base = getattr(base_api, name)
  ...     if not isinstance(fn_base, collections.Callable):
  ...         continue
  ...     fn_sqla = getattr(sqla_api, name, None)
  ...     if not fn_sqla or not isinstance(fn_sqla, collections.Callable):
  ...         print(f'missing function in nova.api.sqlalchemy.db: {name}')
  ...     spec_base = inspect.getfullargspec(fn_base)
  ...     spec_sqla = inspect.getfullargspec(fn_sqla)
  ...     if spec_base != spec_sqla:
  ...         print('mismatched function specs:')
  ...         print(f'base: {spec_base}')
  ...         print(f'sqla: {spec_sqla}')
  ...     break

In order for *this* to work, it was necessary to update the many
decorators in 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api' so that function signatures were
preserved. This is possible by setting the signature of the wrapper to
that of the wrapped function.

Change-Id: Icb97a8b4e17fdbb2146ddf2729c906757c664f66
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-05-11 14:29:03.000000000', 'message': "db: Synchronize function signatures

commit_message:
db: Synchronize function signatures

A number of the abstract APIs in 'nova.db.api' had a different function
signature to their concrete implementations in 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api'.
Correct this. Functions changed include:

- action_get_by_request_id
- create_context_manager
- instance_add_security_group
- instance_extra_update_by_uuid
- instance_get_all_by_filters
- instance_remove_security_group
- migration_get
- migration_get_by_id_and_instance
- pci_device_update
- service_get_minimum_version
- virtual_interface_delete_by_instance
- virtual_interface_get_by_instance
- virtual_interface_get_by_instance_and_network

To do this, the following script was used:

  >>> import nova.db.api as base_api
  >>> import nova.db.sqlalchemy.api as sqla_api
  >>> import collections
  >>> import inspect
  >>> for name in dir(base_api):
  ...     fn_base = getattr(base_api, name)
  ...     if not isinstance(fn_base, collections.Callable):
  ...         continue
  ...     fn_sqla = getattr(sqla_api, name, None)
  ...     if not fn_sqla or not isinstance(fn_sqla, collections.Callable):
  ...         print(f'missing function in nova.api.sqlalchemy.db: {name}')
  ...     spec_base = inspect.getfullargspec(fn_base)
  ...     spec_sqla = inspect.getfullargspec(fn_sqla)
  ...     if spec_base != spec_sqla:
  ...         print('mismatched function specs:')
  ...         print(f'base: {spec_base}')
  ...         print(f'sqla: {spec_sqla}')
  ...     break

In order for *this* to work, it was necessary to update the many
decorators in 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api' so that function signatures were
preserved. This is possible by setting the signature of the wrapper to
that of the wrapped function.

Change-Id: Icb97a8b4e17fdbb2146ddf2729c906757c664f66
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-04-14 17:43:16.000000000', 'message': "db: Copy docs from 'nova.db.*' to 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.*'

We want to remove a level of indirection. Preserve the useful things
here, specifically, the docstrings. This was managed using the following
script:

  >>> from nova.db import api as api_a
  >>> from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as api_b
  >>> from inspect import getmembers, isfunction
  >>> members_a = dict(getmembers(api_a, isfunction))
  >>> members_b = dict(getmembers(api_b, isfunction))
  >>> mismatch_members = []
  >>> for member in members_a:
  ...     if member in members_b:
  ...         doc_a = members_a[member].__doc__
  ...         doc_a = doc_a.strip() if doc_a else doc_a
  ...         doc_b = members_b[member].__doc__
  ...         doc_b = doc_b.strip() if doc_b else doc_b
  ...         if doc_a and doc_a != doc_b:
  ...             mismatch_members.append(member)
  >>> for member in mismatch_members:
  ...     print(member)

The docstrings are still missing a lot of information about parameters,
but that can be addressed another time/never.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Copy docs from 'nova.db.*' to 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.*'

We want to remove a level of indirection. Preserve the useful things
here, specifically, the docstrings. This was managed using the following
script:

  >>> from nova.db import api as api_a
  >>> from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as api_b
  >>> from inspect import getmembers, isfunction
  >>> members_a = dict(getmembers(api_a, isfunction))
  >>> members_b = dict(getmembers(api_b, isfunction))
  >>> mismatch_members = []
  >>> for member in members_a:
  ...     if member in members_b:
  ...         doc_a = members_a[member].__doc__
  ...         doc_a = doc_a.strip() if doc_a else doc_a
  ...         doc_b = members_b[member].__doc__
  ...         doc_b = doc_b.strip() if doc_b else doc_b
  ...         if doc_a and doc_a != doc_b:
  ...             mismatch_members.append(member)
  >>> for member in mismatch_members:
  ...     print(member)

The docstrings are still missing a lot of information about parameters,
but that can be addressed another time/never.

Change-Id: I9f414cf831316b624132d9e06192f1ecbbd3dd78
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

just looking at https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1215075/#2348913
i am not on the ovs maining list on my current account but can you comunicate to the ovs team that we would prefer not ot have any depency on ovs-appctl form openstack and that we want the stateful nature of the ovsdb when setting the mac specificaly so that you cannot alter the mac via ip tools even when that is possibel so that ovs will always restore the mac to the one we programed in the db.

os-vif is often not packaged with the ovs commandline tools in a containerised deployment as we try as much as posible to use the python bindings for ovs insetead so if we can avoid using appctl that is a big win as packager dont need to ship the command line tools for ovs in the nova compute container and we will not need to add new config options for how to connect via ovs-appctl.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2020-02-18 11:20:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> just looking at https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1215075/#2348913
 > i am not on the ovs maining list on my current account but can you
 > comunicate to the ovs team that we would prefer not ot have any
 > depency on ovs-appctl form openstack and that we want the stateful
 > nature of the ovsdb when setting the mac specificaly so that you
 > cannot alter the mac via ip tools even when that is possibel so
 > that ovs will always restore the mac to the one we programed in the
 > db.
 > 
 > os-vif is often not packaged with the ovs commandline tools in a
 > containerised deployment as we try as much as posible to use the
 > python bindings for ovs insetead so if we can avoid using appctl
 > that is a big win as packager dont need to ship the command line
 > tools for ovs in the nova compute container and we will not need to
 > add new config options for how to connect via ovs-appctl.
@Sean, 
You raise valid points which some of them already discussed in the ovs community. My understanding is that BenP against saving mac address in db to ports which are not internal ovs ports. The reason is so we don't have duplicate ways to make mac address persistence in the system. (You can also configure mac address with network-scripts). this is why ovs-appctl was chosen. If you have a better way to solve this I suggest to send mail to the community and raise you concerns there"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-02-18 11:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

if ovs-appctl will be the path forward then you need to ensure that the ovs python binding are also extended and this patch is refactored to use the python bindings. i really dont want to call ovs-appctl form os-vif as we have been trying to remove all use of processutil or direct process spawning to invoke clis for the last few release so i dont want to add another case of that if we can avoid it.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2020-03-15 21:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2020-03-15 21:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2020-03-16 08:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-30 14:13:38.000000000', 'message': '[Follow Up] OVS DPDK port representors support

Pass VF MAC address to ovs to set in case of netdev VIFHostDevice.

In case of DPDK representor port, Nova will pass through the VF PCI
as a hostdev and os-vif should pass the MAC to ovs as it would be
responsible for setting its MAC.
Moreover, when not using dpdk, libvirt does the mac cleanup,
since the VF is managed by libvirt, but when using DPDK,
libvirt does not manage the VF so we need to cleanup MAC address
in os-vif.

Change-Id: I1d5ca371172166d150889047b30636678e330c1e
Closes-Bug: #1829734
'}, {'created': '2020-03-15 21:04:29.000000000', 'message': '[Follow Up] OVS DPDK port representors support

Set VF MAC using appctl in case of netdev VIFHostDevice.

In case of DPDK representor port, Nova will pass through the VF PCI
as a hostdev and os-vif should pass the MAC to ovs as it would be
responsible for setting its MAC.
Moreover, when not using dpdk, libvirt does the mac cleanup,
since the VF is managed by libvirt, but when using DPDK,
libvirt does not manage the VF so we need to cleanup MAC address
in os-vif.

Change-Id: I1d5ca371172166d150889047b30636678e330c1e
Closes-Bug: #1829734
'}, {'created': '2020-03-15 21:14:40.000000000', 'message': '[Follow Up] OVS DPDK port representors support

Set VF MAC using appctl in case of netdev VIFHostDevice.

In case of DPDK representor port, Nova will pass through the VF PCI
as a hostdev and os-vif should pass the MAC to ovs as it would be
responsible for setting its MAC.
Moreover, when not using dpdk, libvirt does the mac cleanup,
since the VF is managed by libvirt, but when using DPDK,
libvirt does not manage the VF so we need to cleanup MAC address
in os-vif.

Change-Id: I1d5ca371172166d150889047b30636678e330c1e
Closes-Bug: #1829734

commit_message:
[Follow Up] OVS DPDK port representors support

Set/Clean VF MAC using OVS Vswitchd in case of DPDK port representor

In case of DPDK port representor, Nova will pass through the VF PCI
as a hostdev and os-vif should program the MAC to ovs as it would be
responsible for managing its MAC.
Moreover, when not using dpdk, libvirt does the mac cleanup,
since the VF is managed by libvirt, but when using DPDK,
libvirt does not manage the VF so we need to cleanup MAC address
in os-vif.

Change-Id: I1d5ca371172166d150889047b30636678e330c1e
Closes-Bug: #1829734

commit_message:
db: Remove 'nova.db.base' module

This made sense back in the day where the ORM was configurable and we
were making lots of direct calls to the database. Now, in a world where
most things happen via o.vo, it's just noise. Remove it.

Change-Id: I216cabcde5311abd46fdad9c95bb72c31b414010
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add option to set template paths in env population

Overcloud node and network provisioning plays currently
write environment files with a hard coded THT-root path.

Add 'templates' parameter to the modules so that the user
can specify the templates path.

Related-Bug: #1932079
Change-Id: I9decd8fb9860cd17dc9e69b9970d9f9dabf11428

export passwords selectively, if needed, based on provided rules.

This patch restores that functionality.
Furthermore, tests were adjusted to validate exports with and
without filtering.

Function level documentation was expanded with information about

Per suggestion, the loop was adjusted to iterate over generated passwords

Closes-Bug: #1933237

commit_message:
Restoration of the 'export_passwords' exclusion

The 'tripleoclient.export.export_passwords' function was intended
export passwords selectively, if needed, based on provided rules.

This patch restores that functionality.
Furthermore, tests were adjusted to validate exports with and
without filtering.

Function level documentation was expanded with information about
inputs and outputs.

Per suggestion, the loop was adjusted to iterate over generated passwords
rather than over `tripleo_common_constants.PASSWORD_PARAMETER_NAMES`.
The existing import of tripleo_common.constants was removed, as there
were no more references to it.

Closes-Bug: #1933237

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I397caaf314dae17a48d4aeed55f1a5a8e4ae3d41

commit_message:
Don't use identity api to check nova availability

With no keystone, we can't use identity api directly.
Check for 'nova service list' instead.

Also removes use --os-cloud from the commands.

Change-Id: Ia9054452aef97d0e2fb3abe6617aee3bf053a164

subject: Add playbook to perform UC DB backup only.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-06-29 15:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-01 14:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-29 15:40:50.000000000', 'message': "Add playbook to perform UC DB backup only.

Currently, the openstack undercloud backup command allows us setting
up rear, nfs and run the Undercloud's backup. However, it might be
useful to just perform a DB backup instead of a full backup of the
Undercloud.

This patch adds a new playbook cli-undercloud-db-backup.yaml which
invokes only the db_backup.yml play from the backup_and_restore

commit_message:
Add playbook to perform UC DB backup only.

Currently, the openstack undercloud backup command allows us setting
up rear, nfs and run the Undercloud's backup. However, it might be
useful to just perform a DB backup instead of a full backup of the
Undercloud.

This patch adds a new playbook cli-undercloud-db-backup.yaml which
invokes only the db_backup.yml play from the backup_and_restore
role. This will perform only the MariaDB database backup for the
Undercloud node. As the file name was hardcoded in the play, this
patch also parametrizes it so that it will be possible to run
the command multiple times without override an existing backup.

Related: rhbz#1977392
Change-Id: I62cadfd95c514edf0b982fa652a53feadb24f2b7
(cherry picked from commit 0f221aca95252b0851b64548471f0b548016705c)

commit_message:
Restart octavia rsyslog after updating the config

After creating the octavia rsyslog configuration file, the
octavia_rsyslog container must be restarted if it's already running,
otherwise the new configuration is not applied in the container.

This issue is new, the octavia-ansible playbook was moved from step 5 to
post_deploy, which means that the file is now created after the first start
of the container.

Change-Id: Ibb439d47d551adc5af2d87234b732565af1cc90f

commit_message:
Restart octavia rsyslog after updating the config

After creating the octavia rsyslog configuration file, the
octavia_rsyslog container must be restarted if it's already running,
otherwise the new configuration is not applied in the container.

This issue is new, the octavia-ansible playbook was moved from step 5 to
post_deploy, which means that the file is now created after the first start
of the container.

Change-Id: Ibb439d47d551adc5af2d87234b732565af1cc90f
(cherry picked from commit 0a6f775201ee6868e76da8dfbbdf977ed1763dca)

commit_message:
Make memcache also listen to localhost

Currently memcache only listens to the internal_api IP. We want to
make it listen to both localhost and internal_api IP because in the
future some services on some roles may want to just use the localhost
memcached instance instead of the using multiple memcached servers
over the network as it is the case currently.

As suggested by Takashi we check the ip version in MemcachedNetwork
in order to decide if we should listen to ::1 or 127.0.0.1

Change-Id: I6ea989ae546ef344a9b3d2dd6c86a49822efc6e2
(cherry picked from commit acf08419bc4a4076ecb24b79c3c5ef52825eeb6b)
(cherry picked from commit 546d994d04c5b8c7b170339b816841ffa7bea6bf)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I12bb3359f824bcbbe662a348a2b833fa3a4b7952

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7ff768341d23085540d2af339b4b2f6600b3fb28
